intro: Hemitelia nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with distinct venation. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they are clustered in inflorescences. Hemitelia nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
